feed.title: side-chains & 2-way pegging (Re: is there a way to do bitcoin-staging?)

entry.title: side-chains & 2-way pegging (Re: is there a way to do bitcoin-staging?)
entry.summary: The provided context includes a PGP signed message with a hash value of SHA512. The message contains links to two websites, IACR and DES, which are related to cryptography. The first link is to the proceedings of Eurocrypt 2002, a conference on cryptology, while the second link is to the accepted papers for Asiacrypt 2014, another cryptographic conference. Following these links, Andrew Poelstra's message appears, where he mentions a "false proof" without any further context or explanation. Additionally, the signature at the end of the message confirms its authenticity and integrity. Lastly, the message includes a brief description of the website abis.io, which proposes a protocol concept to enable decentralization and expansion of a giving economy, as well as a link to Keybase, a platform for secure messaging and file sharing.
